TITLE: Divisive social media star Andrew Tate detained in Romania in human trafficking case
SUMMARY: New father Yappe Pako gets help with his kangaroo care carrier from a midwife. His newborn son is named Ambo Crisostome. They're in the kangaroo care ward at the University Hospital Medical Center at Treichville in the Ivory Coast. A new program teaches the technique to moms and dads. It's especially beneficial for preterm and low birthweight babies. Andrew Caballero-Reynolds for NPR

TITLE: Britain's 2022 Was A Year Of Epic Turbulence
SUMMARY: From left, former British Prime Minister Liz Truss, Labour Party leader Keir Starmer, former British Prime Minister Boris Johnson, and Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and former British Prime Minister Theresa May attend the Remembrance Sunday ceremony at the Cenotaph on Whitehall in London, on Nov. 13

TITLE: Editors' picks: Our best global photos of 2022 range from heart-rending to hopeful
SUMMARY: New father Yappe Pako gets help with his kangaroo care carrier from a midwife. His newborn son is named Ambo Crisostome. They're in the kangaroo care ward at the University Hospital Medical Center at Treichville in the Ivory Coast. A new program teaches the technique to moms and dads. It's especially beneficial for preterm and low birthweight babies. Andrew Caballero-Reynolds for NPR

TITLE: Retired Pope Benedict XVI dies at 95
SUMMARY: Pope Benedict XVI greets a crowd in Venice's St. Mark's Square in 2011

TITLE: Cristiano Ronaldo signs with a Saudi soccer club
SUMMARY: Cristiano Ronaldo smiles before the start of Manchester United's match against Sheriff at Old Trafford in Manchester, England, on Oct. 27

TITLE: War against Ukraine has left Russia isolated and struggling — with more tumult ahead
SUMMARY: Police officers detain demonstrators in St. Petersburg, Russia, on Sept. 21, following calls to protest against the partial mobilization announced by President Vladimir Putin. Putin called on Russian military reservists, saying his promise to use all military means in Ukraine was "no bluff," and hinting that Moscow was prepared to use nuclear weapons

TITLE: He lost his legs fighting for Ukraine. But this story is about love through adversity
SUMMARY: Sgt. Mykhailo (Misha) Varvarych, 28, and his fiance, Iryna (Ira) Botvynska, 19, take part in a therapeutic swimming activity at Moldova pool in Truskavets, Ukraine. Carol Guzy for NPR

TITLE: Russia launches a wave of missiles at Ukraine in a massive New Year's Eve air attack
SUMMARY: People gather at the bottom of a hotel, which has been partially destroyed by a Russian strike in the center of the Ukrainian capital Kyiv on Saturday. Sergei Supinsky/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Thousands mourn Benedict XVI at funeral celebrated by pope
SUMMARY: Archbishop Georg Ganswein kneels by the coffin of late Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI is brought to St. Peter's Square for a funeral mass at the Vatican, Thursday, Jan. 5, 2023

TITLE: Condoleezza Rice calls for 'urgency' in sending weapons and money to Ukraine
SUMMARY: Former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice - pictured here at a reception of the American Academy in Berlin - has called for "urgency" in sending weapons and financial aid to Ukraine

TITLE: Russia names a new commander for its war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba during a meeting of the NATO Ministers of Foreign Affairs in November. STOYAN NENOV/POOL/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: What Putin's shake-up of top commanders could mean for the war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: In a move that experts say is a key shift for Russia, the Kremlin has named General Valery Gerasimov as the new overall commander of the war in Ukraine

TITLE: Where The Ukraine War Goes Next
SUMMARY: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba during a meeting of the NATO Ministers of Foreign Affairs in November. STOYAN NENOV/POOL/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: The U.K. pledges tanks to Ukraine as Russian missiles target multiple cities
SUMMARY: In this photo released by the Dnipro Regional Administration, smoke rises after a Russian rocket hit a multistory building leaving many people under debris in Dnipro, Ukraine, on Saturday. Dnipro Regional Administration via AP

TITLE: The death toll from a Russian strike on an apartment complex in Ukraine is now 29
SUMMARY: Emergency workers clear the rubble after a Russian rocket hit a multistory building leaving many people under debris in the southeastern city of Dnipro, Ukraine, on Jan. 14, 2023

TITLE: Expanded U.S. training for Ukraine forces begins in Germany
SUMMARY: FILE - Weapons lie on the ground as Ukrainian personnel train at a base in Southern England. The U.S. military's new, expanded combat training of Ukrainian forces began in Germany on Jan. 15

TITLE: Death toll in Russian strike on Ukrainian building up to at least 35
SUMMARY: In this photo released by the State Emergency Service of Ukraine, firefighters carry a wounded woman out of the rubble of a building after a Russian rocket attack on Saturday in Dnipro

TITLE: Germany's defense minister steps down after a string of widely criticized missteps
SUMMARY: Christine Lambrecht rides in a tank during her visit to Tank Training Brigade 9 in Munster, Germany, Feb. 7, 2022

TITLE: A firefighter's 1943 photos of the Warsaw Ghetto uprising have been found
SUMMARY: This handout negative dated on April 20, 1943, and taken by Polish firefighter Zbigniew Leszek Grzywaczewski shows Jewish people being evacuated from the Warsaw Ghetto. Z. L. Grzywaczewski/Maciej Grzywaczewski/POLIN Museum via AP

TITLE: President Zelenskyy shakes up Ukraine's Cabinet amid corruption allegations
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy pays his respects to victims of a deadly helicopter crash during a farewell ceremony in Kyiv, Ukraine, on Jan. 21

TITLE: Latest on Ukraine: Waiting for Germany's Leopard tanks (Jan. 23)
SUMMARY: A man plays violin on the sidelines of a religious service held by local residents in front of an apartment building in the Ukrainian city of Dnipro on Sunday. The building was destroyed by a Russian missile strike on Jan. 14. Anatolii Stepanov/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: The U.K. government says more than 200 child asylum-seekers are missing
SUMMARY: Robert Jenrick, Britain's minister of state for immigration, arrives for a Cabinet meeting in Downing street in London on Tuesday

TITLE: The Doomsday Clock moves to 90 seconds to midnight, signaling more peril than ever
SUMMARY: The Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists announced that it has moved the minute hand of the Doomsday Clock to 90 seconds to midnight. From left,, Siegfried Hecker, Daniel Holz, Sharon Squassoni, Mary Robinson and Elbegdorj Tsakhia with the Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists remove a cloth covering the Doomsday Clock at a news conference at the National Press Club in Washington on Tuesday

TITLE: Survey shows a lack of Holocaust awareness in the country that was home to Anne Frank
SUMMARY: King Willem-Alexander puts a stone in an act of remembrance when unveiling a new monument in the heart of Amsterdam's historic Jewish Quarter on Sept. 19, 2021, honoring the 102,000 Dutch victims of the Holocaust

TITLE: Germany agrees to send its Leopard battle tanks to Ukraine after weeks of pressure
SUMMARY: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz stands next to a Leopard 2 main battle tank of the German armed forces while visiting an army training center in Ostenholz, Germany, on Oct. 17, 2022

TITLE: The U.S. and Germany pledge tanks to Ukraine, signaling heavy fighting ahead
SUMMARY: U.S. Abrams tanks participate in a live fire demonstration during training exercises in Poland in September 2022. President Biden announced Wednesday that the U.S. will be sending 31 Abrams tanks to Ukraine. Germany also said it will be sending tanks

TITLE: German And American Tanks Are Headed for Ukraine
SUMMARY: A M1A2 Abrams battle tank. The U.S. has agreed to send 31 of the tanks to Ukraine to help it defend and reclaim its territory from Russian forces. Mateusz Slodkowski/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Her ancestors survived the Holocaust. She returns to Germany to reclaim her identity
Who's most likely to save us from the next pandemic? The answer may surprise you
SUMMARY: Yeshnee Naidoo prepares a "flow cell" for analysis by one of the center's many genetic sequencing machines. Tommy Trenchard for NPR

TITLE: European leaders meet in Kyiv to discuss Ukraine's path toward joining the EU
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen shake hands after a joint press conference after talks in Kyiv on Thursday. Sergei Supinsky/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Tate Modern's terrace is a nuisance for wealthy neighbors, top U.K. court rules
SUMMARY: Owners of apartments (seen at right) opposite Tate Modern have won a privacy case against the famous art gallery. SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images

TITLE: Polish ambassador warns of a prolonged war in Ukraine, calls for more support
SUMMARY: Marek Magierowski (right), the Polish ambassador to the U.S., speaks with host Steve Inskeep at the Polish Embassy in Washington, D.C., on Thursday

TITLE: Europe bans Russian oil products, the latest strike on the Kremlin war chest
SUMMARY: Tires of a truck are pictured at a gas station in Frankfurt, Germany, Jan. 27. A European ban on imports of diesel fuel and other products made from crude oil in Russian refineries takes effect Feb. 5. The goal is to stop feeding Russia's war chest, but fuel costs have already jumped since the war started and they could rise again

TITLE: Dozens of soldiers are freed in a Russia-Ukraine prisoner swap
SUMMARY: Ukrainian State Emergency Service firefighters put out a fire after Russian shelling hit an industrial area in Kherson, Ukraine, on Friday

TITLE: Shlomo Perel, a Holocaust survivor who inspired the film 'Europa Europa,' dies at 98
SUMMARY: This undated photo provided by Yad Vashem Holocaust Memorial shows Shlomo Perel at his home in Givatayim, Israel. Perel, who survived the Holocaust through surreal subterfuge and an extraordinary odyssey that inspired his own writing and an internationally renowned film, has died. He was 98. Yad Vashem Holocaust Memorial via AP

TITLE: The Pope has called for peace in South Sudan in the final part of his Africa tour
SUMMARY: Pope Francis arrives to celebrate mass at the John Garang Mausoleum in Juba, South Sudan, Sunday, Feb. 5, 2023. Francis is in South Sudan on the second leg of a six-day trip that started in Congo, hoping to bring comfort and encouragement to two countries that have been riven by poverty, conflicts and what he calls a "colonialist mentality" that has exploited Africa for centuries

TITLE: Latest on Ukraine: EU just banned Russian diesel and other oil products (Feb. 6)
SUMMARY: Black smoke rises after shelling in Bakhmut, in eastern Ukraine, on Feb. 3, amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Yasuyoshi Chiba/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Latest in Ukraine: Updates on Russia's war and a look ahead (Feb. 13)
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy (left) walks with French President Emmanuel Macron on the tarmac of Vélizy-Villacoublay airbase as they prepare to board a flight together, en route to Brussels for a summit at European Parliament, on Feb. 9. Zelenskyy made a surprise Europe tour last week. Mohammed Badra/Pool/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Russia deports thousands of Ukrainian children. Investigators say that's a war crime
SUMMARY: A view of the courtyard of Kherson regional children's home in Kherson, southern Ukraine, Friday, Nov. 25, 2022. Russian authorities have been accused of deporting Ukrainian children to Russia to raise them as their own. Thousands of children were seized from schools and orphanages in Ukraine by Russian authorities, according to researchers at Yale University

TITLE: Blinken has a lot on his plate including tensions with China and the war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken speaks in the briefing room of the State Department in Washington, Jan. 7, 2022

TITLE: European allies condemn Israel's plan to build more housing units in the West Bank
SUMMARY: A picture taken from the Palestinian village of Aqraba shows the Israeli settlement outpost of Gevat Arnon, near Nablus city in the southern occupied West Bank. Jaafar Ashitiyeh/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: U.N. agencies seek $5.6 billion to help Ukraine, its refugees abroad
SUMMARY: A man receives humanitarian aid provided by U.N. World Food Program and ADRA charity organization for the residents of the region and internally displaced persons at the distribution center in Kostiantynivka, Ukraine, Friday, Feb. 10, 2023

TITLE: Scotland's Nicola Sturgeon, supporter of independence and trans rights, will resign
SUMMARY: Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon announced Wednesday that she would step down. Jane Barlow/Pool/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: One of 12 boys rescued from the Thai cave dies at a British school
SUMMARY: Relatives of Duangphet "Dom" Phromthep, one of the boys rescued from the flooded cave in northern Thailand, greet him as he arrives home in the Mae Sai district, Chiang Rai province, northern Thailand, in 2018

TITLE: Indian tax inspectors leave BBC offices after nearly 60 hours of questioning
SUMMARY: A Border Police officer stands guard outside the office building where Indian tax authorities raided BBC's office in New Delhi. Sajjad Hussain/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Ukraine says it shot down 6 Russian balloons that appeared over Kyiv
SUMMARY: One of the balloons the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine says they shot down. General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine

TITLE: The economic war against Russia, a year later
SUMMARY: Tetiana Horobstova, 70, and her husband, Volodymyr, on the balcony of their home, where their daughter was talking on the phone when Russian soldiers came to arrest her in Kherson, Ukraine. Laurel Chor for NPR

TITLE: The key trends to watch in the Russia-Ukraine war
SUMMARY: Pedestrians walk past a large mural of Russian President Vladimir Putin on a residential building in Kashira, a town south of Moscow, on Thursday. Natalia Kolesnikova/AFP via Getty Images

TITLE: Kherson's underground resistance: How ordinary people fought Russia from the shadows
SUMMARY: Tetiana Horobstova, 70, and her husband, Volodymyr, on the balcony of their home, where their daughter was talking on the phone when Russian soldiers came to arrest her in Kherson, Ukraine. Laurel Chor for NPR

TITLE: For Ukrainians in Dubai, a new restaurant offers a taste of home
SUMMARY: (Left) A Ukrainian chef prepares mashed potatoes in the kitchen at Yoy restaurant. (Right) Traditional Ukrainian beet stew known as borsch is being prepared. It's the restaurant's most popular dish

TITLE: Italy has kept its fascist monuments and buildings. The reasons are complex
SUMMARY: The fascist origins of this Roman sports center can be seen in its monumental sculpture and architecture

TITLE: Dozens of migrants have been killed in a shipwreck off the coast of Italy
SUMMARY: Rescuers recover a body at a beach near Cutro, southern Italy, after a migrant boat broke apart in rough seas, Sunday, Feb. 26, 2023. Rescue officials say dozens of migrants have died after their boat broke apart off southern Italy

TITLE: Janet Yellen visits Ukraine and pledges even more U.S. economic aid
SUMMARY: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen speaks at a school in Kyiv, Ukraine, on Monday

TITLE: When will it be over? And 9 more questions about Russia, Ukraine and a year of war
SUMMARY: The Ukrainian flag flutters between buildings destroyed in bombardment in the Ukrainian town of Borodianka. It was one year ago last week that Russia invaded. Sergei Supinksy/AFP via Getty Images
